title: Jack Nowell and Mako Vunipola keen to make their mark at World Cup after long roads back to fitness
text:
For all the limited encouragement that England can draw from defeating Argentina’s 14 men on Saturday, the biggest fillip for their World Cup prospects was provided by the return of Jack Nowell and Mako Vunipola from the replacements bench.

It has been a long road for both to be back in an England shirt. Along the way, each player has entertained doubts whether they would make it this far.

For Exeter wing Nowell, this was his first competitive action since injuring his ankle in the Premiership final on June 1. He then had his appendix removed just weeks before the start of the tournament. He betrayed no signs of rust as he bounced three Argentinean defenders to score a brilliant try after coming...
description: For all the limited encouragement that England can draw from defeating Argentina’s 14 men on Saturday, the biggest fillip for their World Cup prospects was provided by the return of Jack Nowell and Mako Vunipola from the replacements bench.
